page.title: 07RECREATION IN SWINDERBY.
page.content: In 1985 residents can occupy their {freetime} in many ways. {Children}can belong to the playgroup, Guides or youth club at the Village Hall, or Shell Group at the Methodist Church. Members of many families go horse riding, play football, belong to the dancing school, go to North Hykeham Sports Centre or North Scarle Tennis Club. Other{hobbies}are golf, sailing, canoeing, surfing and cycling. {Adults} can belong to the Women's Fellowship, Women's Institute, Bowls Club or visit the {Plough Public House where they can play darts, have a snack, a bar meal or a drink and meet their friends. It is open every lunchtime and evening. Outside it has a garden with seats, 2 old ploughs and window boxes containing pretty flowers. There is a childrens play ground in the garden.
